votebox.middle.ballot

Class Ballot

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.ballot.Ballot

  • public final class Ballot
extends java.lang.Object
    Ballots can only be created by instances of this delegate, which are handed out to known The Ballot Class represents the runtime version of the ballot. This means that a Ballot contains both Cards and Properties. The Cards define the information that the user will be presented with and the Properties determine how that information will be presented.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ballot

        public Ballot(java.util.List<Card> cards,
      Properties properties,
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,SelectableCardElement> elements,
      java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> raceGroups)
        This is Ballot's public constructor.
        Parameters:
        cards - These are the cards that make up this ballot
        properties - These are the properties that were defined in the ballot's XML file.
        elements - These are the elements that make up this ballot. This is a dictionary mapping a unique id to its corresponding card element for every card element contained in this ballot
        raceGroups - For every race, the race-ids that make it up. This is equivalent to a list of lists such that each sub list may only have one child element selected in a valid ballot at any time.

      • getNumSelections

        public int getNumSelections()
        Call this method to get the number of selections that have been made on this ballot. This does not include selections of "none.' This only includes non-empty selections present at the time of the method call. *
        Returns:
        _numSelections

      • incrementSelections

        public void incrementSelections()
        Call this method to decrement the count of the number of selections that the ballot thinks have been made. This method should only be called by SelectableCardElement.

      • decrementSelections

        public void decrementSelections()
        Call this method to decrement the count of the number of selections that the ballot thinks have been made. This method should only be called by SelectableCardElement.

               throws UnknownUIDException,
                      SelectionException
        Selects an element based on its UID.
        Parameters:
        uniqueID - - UID in question
        Returns:
        the result of SelectableCardElement.select(), on the found element
        Throws:
        UnknownUIDException - - if element with uniqueID could not be found
        SelectionException - - if selection failed

      • selectedElement

        public java.lang.String selectedElement(java.lang.String UID)
                                 throws NonCardException,
                                        UnknownUIDException,
                                        CardException
        Returns the UID of the selected element in the card identified by UID.
        Parameters:
        UID - - UID of card to interrogate
        Returns:
        the UID of that card's selected element, if any
        Throws:
        NonCardException - - if UID does not map to a Card
        UnknownUIDException - - if UID does not exist
        CardException - - If more than one element is selected on the given Card.

      • toASExpression

        public ASExpression toASExpression()
        Returns:
        the SExpression representation of this Ballot.

      • getCastBallot

        public ListExpression getCastBallot()
        New as of 1/28/2008: Cast ballot representation.
        Returns:
        This method returns the cast ballot representation, ready for encryption. Each selectable in the ballot is represented by the pair (uid, counter), where "counter" is either BigInteger.ZERO or BigInteger.ONE (in byte[] format, converted to an s-expression byte string).

      • getRaceGroups

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getRaceGroups()

        Returns:
        the race groups of this ballots
